title: Supreme Court Refuses to Let Trump Deploy National Guard in Chicago
summary: The move signals that the justices are likely to immediately block similar deployments in other U.S. cities.

title: Student Loan Borrowers in Default Could See Wages Garnished in Early 2026
summary: Starting the week of Jan. 7, the Education Department will begin sending notices about paycheck deductions to about 1,000 of five million borrowers in default.

title: National Guard Troops to Arrive in New Orleans
summary: The troops will join an existing wave of Border Patrol agents, months after Gov. Jeff Landry first suggested that the National Guard could help tamp down on crime in Louisiana.

title: Federal Prosecutor Was Surprised by Trump’s Flights on Epstein’s Jet
summary: A 2020 email noted that Donald Trump was listed as a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein’s jet at least eight times from 1993 to 1996.

title: Pulled ’60 Minutes’ Report, Briefly Streamed in Canada, Is All Over the Internet Now
summary: At the last minute, CBS News held a segment about Venezuelan men who were deported by the Trump administration to a prison in El Salvador. It surfaced online anyway.

title: Stephen Miller Cites Children of Immigrants as a Problem
summary: As it seeks to end birthright citizenship, the Trump administration is arguing that immigrants bring problems that extend for generations. The data shows otherwise.

title: Kate Winslet’s Unhappy Family Christmas
summary: The British actress’s directorial debut, “Goodbye June,” is based on a script written by her son and follows a fractured family reuniting in the hospital over the holidays.

title: Trump’s Tanker Crackdown Paralyzes Venezuelan Oil Exports
summary: Oil exports, the country’s financial lifeblood, have plummeted after the United States took action against three ships that have been used to carry its crude.

title: U.S. Is Adding to Its Military Buildup in the Caribbean
summary: Over the past week, C-17 heavy-lift cargo planes, which usually transport troops and equipment, flew to Puerto Rico at least 16 times, according to flight tracking data reviewed by The New York Times.

title: This Texas Family Was Part of the Biggest U.S. Measles Outbreak in a Generation
summary: The measles outbreak in the United States is now in its 11th month, with almost 2,000 cases. The Timmons family were some of the first people to get sick.

title: ‘I Feel Like I’ve Been Lied To’: When a Measles Outbreak Hits Home
summary: From a lone clinic in Texas to an entire school district in North Dakota, the virus is upending daily life and revealing a deeper crisis of belief.

title: The Confederacy Goes on Trial, Along With Schools Named Jackson and Lee
summary: In an unusual trial, the N.A.A.C.P. has sought to show a school board’s “racist intent” by proving that the names of Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jackson can’t be separated from white supremacy.

title: Oklahoma Instructor Mel Curth Who Failed Student Samantha Fulnecky’s Gender Essay Is Fired
summary: The instructor, a graduate student at the University of Oklahoma, gave a zero to a student who wrote an essay arguing in favor of traditional gender definitions based on biblical teachings.

title: Nursing Home Explosion in Bristol, Pennsylvania, Leaves Multiple Injured
summary: Officials believe the explosion at the Bristol Health and Rehab Center in Bristol Township was caused by a gas leak. It resulted in a big fire and partial collapse of the building, they said.

title: Suspect in Brown University Shooting Worked in Portugal After Leaving University
summary: One friend said Claudio Neves Valente appeared to live a detached life, upset that “he couldn’t be the genius he thought he should be.”

title: Do Parents Have Favorite Children? Of Course They Do.
summary: And research shows the less favored children suffer for it.

title: ‘The Queen of Versailles’ Bombed on Broadway. What Went Wrong?
summary: The show reunited Kristin Chenoweth and Stephen Schwartz for the first time since “Wicked.” It wasn’t enough to counter poor word of mouth and other challenges.

title: Youth Hostels, Blood Banks, Yoga: How One Far-Right Network Spread Across the World
summary: Far-right mobilization is not an inevitable consequence of the precariousness of our times.

title: The Real-Life Marty Supreme Taught Me How to Hustle
summary: When I first moved to New York City, Marty Reisman befriended me.

title: Justices Block National Guard Deployment in Chicago
summary: Also, economic growth surged through the summer. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Libyan Military’s Chief of Staff and 4 Others Are Killed in Plane Crash in Turkey
summary: The internationally recognized government of Libya confirmed the deaths of Lt. Gen. Mohamed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad, the army chief of general staff, and other officers flying home after a meeting in Turkey.

title: Mamdani Named His Fire Commissioner. Then Adams Did Too.
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani chose Lillian Bonsignore, the former chief of New York’s E.M.S., as the first openly gay person to lead the Fire Department.

title: U.S. GDP Grew 4.3%, Surging in Third Quarter of 2025
summary: Gross domestic product grew at a 4.3 percent annual rate, faster than the previous three months.

title: Robert Nakamura, ‘Godfather’ of Asian American Film, Dies at 88
summary: In his work, he often returned to Manzanar, the camp in which he and his family, along with thousands of other people of Japanese descent, were interned during World War II.
